tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE women_rights_conventions (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    convention_name VARCHAR(255),
    country VARCHAR(255),
    signing_date DATE,
    implementation_status BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE TreatyStatus (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    treaty_id INT,
    signatory_country VARCHAR(50),
    ratification_status VARCHAR(50),
    ratification_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (treaty_id) REFERENCES Conventions(convention_id)
);

CREATE TABLE International_Conventions (
    convention_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    title TEXT NOT NULL,
    country TEXT NOT NULL,
    date_signed DATE,
    date_ratified DATE,
    language TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE conventions (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    country VARCHAR(50),
    ratification_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE treaties (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    title VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    signatory_country VARCHAR(50),
    signing_date DATE,
    ratification_date DATE,
    CONSTRAINT fk_convention_id FOREIGN KEY (convention_id) REFERENCES conventions(id)
);

CREATE TABLE articles (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    article_number INT NOT NULL,
    content TEXT NOT NULL,
    treaty_id INT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_treaty_id FOREIGN KEY (treaty_id) REFERENCES treaties(id)
);

CREATE TABLE violations (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    violation_description TEXT NOT NULL,
    violation_date DATE,
    article_id INT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_article_id FOREIGN KEY (article_id) REFERENCES articles(id)
);

CREATE TABLE `conventions` (
  `id` INT PRIMARY KEY,
  `name` VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  `year` INT NOT NULL,
  `country_id` INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (`country_id`) REFERENCES `countries`(`id`)
);

CREATE TABLE `ratifications` (
  `id` INT PRIMARY KEY,
  `convention_id` INT,
  `country_id` INT,
  `date_ratified` DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (`convention_id`) REFERENCES `conventions`(`id`),
  FOREIGN KEY (`country_id`) REFERENCES `countries`(`id`)
);

CREATE TABLE `signatories` (
  `id` INT PRIMARY KEY,
  `convention_id` INT,
  `country_id` INT,
  `signed_date` DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (`convention_id`) REFERENCES `conventions`(`id`),
  FOREIGN KEY (`country_id`) REFERENCES `countries`(`id`)
);
